mapper.sql: id, good_id, good_name, seller_id, customer_id, money, submit_time, end_time, status_id

good_id,
good_name,

mapper.update:
update goods_order
good_id = #{goodId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
good_name = #{goodName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
seller_id = #{sellerId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
customer_id = #{customerId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
money = #{money,jdbcType=DOUBLE},
submit_time = #{submitTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
end_time = #{endTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
status_id = #{statusId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

update goods_order set good_id = #{goodId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, good_name = #{goodName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, seller_id = #{sellerId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, customer_id = #{customerId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, money = #{money,jdbcType=DOUBLE}, submit_time = #{submitTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, end_time = #{endTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, status_id = #{statusId,jdbcType=INTEGER} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.insert:
insert into goods_order
id,
good_id,
good_name,
seller_id,
customer_id,
money,
submit_time,
end_time,
status_id,
#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{goodId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
#{goodName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{sellerId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{customerId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{money,jdbcType=DOUBLE},
#{submitTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{endTime,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
#{statusId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
mapper.select: select g.id, g.good_id, g.good_name, u1.user_name as seller_id, u2.user_name as customer_id, g.money, g.submit_time, g.end_time, g.status_id from goods_order g join user u1 on g.seller_id=u1.id join user u2 on g.customer_id=u2.id where g.id!=#{goodsOrderId} and g.customer_id=#{customerId} order by submit_time desc

select g.id, g.good_id, g.good_name, u1.user_name as seller_id, u2.user_name as customer_id, g.money, g.submit_time, g.end_time, g.status_id from goods_order g join user u1 on g.seller_id=u1.id join user u2 on g.customer_id=u2.id where g.id=#{id}

select g.id, g.good_id, g.good_name, u1.user_name as seller_id, u2.user_name as customer_id, g.money, g.submit_time, g.end_time, g.status_id from goods_order g join user u1 on g.seller_id=u1.id join user u2 on g.customer_id=u2.id where g.customer_id=#{customerId} order by submit_time desc
select good_id from goods_order where seller_id=#{sellerId} and status_id=#{statusId}
select g.id, u.user_name as seller_id, g.good_id, g.money, g.submit_time, g.status_id from goods_order g join `user` u on g.seller_id=u.id order by submit_time desc
